items.text: I know I am special because everyone keeps telling me so.
items.rationale: Reflects inflated self-importance and a sense of specialness, core to grandiose narcissism.

items.text: I am destined to become one of the great people of my generation.
items.rationale: Captures grandiose fantasies of unlimited success and a sense of destiny.

items.text: I naturally take charge in group situations because I'm the most capable person in the room.
items.rationale: Reflects authoritativeness and inflated self-appraisal of competence relative to others.

items.text: People are always drawn to my personality — I light up any room I walk into.
items.rationale: Captures exhibitionistic charm and belief in one's exceptional social magnetism.

items.text: I deserve special treatment because of who I am.
items.rationale: Directly taps entitlement, a hallmark facet of grandiose narcissism.

items.text: I have no problem using others to get what I want if the situation calls for it.
items.rationale: Reflects exploitativeness and interpersonal manipulation characteristic of grandiose narcissism.

items.text: I enjoy being the center of attention and feel I usually deserve to be.
items.rationale: Captures exhibitionism combined with entitlement, both central to grandiose narcissism.

items.text: When I succeed, it's because of my extraordinary talent; when I fail, it's because of circumstances beyond my control.
items.rationale: Reflects self-serving attributional bias and inflated self-regard typical of grandiose narcissism.

items.text: I can read people like a book and use that to my advantage.
items.rationale: Taps manipulativeness and a sense of interpersonal superiority central to grandiose narcissism.

items.text: I often fantasize about having enormous power and influence over others.
items.rationale: Grandiose fantasies of power are a defining feature of grandiose narcissism.

items.text: Most people don't measure up to my standards.
items.rationale: Reflects arrogance and devaluation of others, core interpersonal features of grandiose narcissism.

items.text: I thrive on compliments and admiration — they fuel me to accomplish even more.
items.rationale: Captures need for admiration paired with agentic confidence, hallmarks of grandiose narcissism.

items.text: Sometimes I bend the rules because they weren't really designed for someone like me.
items.rationale: Reflects entitlement and sense of exceptionalism, though could also reflect general antisocial tendencies.

items.text: I am more confident in my abilities than most people I know.
items.rationale: Captures inflated self-confidence but could also reflect genuine high self-esteem without narcissistic features.

items.text: When someone criticizes me, I feel a flash of rage but quickly remind myself they're just jealous.
items.rationale: The rage response to criticism overlaps with vulnerable narcissism's hypersensitivity, but the dismissive reappraisal ('they're jealous') pulls it toward grandiose narcissism.

items.text: I often feel that others don't appreciate how much I do for them.
items.rationale: Captures the sense of being undervalued and unrecognized that is central to vulnerable narcissism.

items.text: I tend to withdraw from people when I feel they haven't given me the recognition I deserve.
items.rationale: Reflects the combination of entitlement and avoidant coping characteristic of vulnerable narcissism.

items.text: Deep down, I worry that I'm not as competent as people think I am.
items.rationale: Captures the fragile self-esteem and hidden shame underlying vulnerable narcissism.

items.text: Criticism, even when it's minor, can ruin my entire day.
items.rationale: Reflects hypersensitivity to negative evaluation, a defining feature of vulnerable narcissism.

items.text: I often feel envious of others who seem to get the recognition and success that should be mine.
items.rationale: Captures envy combined with a sense of thwarted entitlement, core to vulnerable narcissism.

items.text: I secretly resent people who are more successful than me, even if I act happy for them.
items.rationale: Reflects covert hostility and envy masked by social compliance, hallmarks of vulnerable narcissism.

items.text: When things go wrong in my life, I can't help but feel the world is against me.
items.rationale: Captures the persecutory ideation and self-pity characteristic of vulnerable narcissism.

items.text: I need a lot of reassurance from others to feel good about myself.
items.rationale: Reflects contingent self-esteem and dependency on external validation central to vulnerable narcissism.

items.text: I feel ashamed when I realize I've been seeking attention or approval from others.
items.rationale: Captures the shame-proneness and conflicted need for admiration that defines vulnerable narcissism.

items.text: I often replay social interactions in my head, worrying about whether I looked foolish.
items.rationale: Reflects the self-conscious rumination and social anxiety associated with vulnerable narcissism.

items.text: I feel like I sacrifice more for others than they ever sacrifice for me.
items.rationale: Captures the martyrdom and perceived interpersonal exploitation characteristic of vulnerable narcissism.

items.text: My mood can shift dramatically depending on how others treat me.
items.rationale: Reflects emotional dysregulation and contingent self-worth, core features of vulnerable narcissism.

items.text: I sometimes feel like I deserve more out of life than what I've been given.
items.rationale: Captures entitlement with a frustrated, deprived quality, though entitlement also features in grandiose narcissism.

items.text: I find it hard to be genuinely happy for a friend's success when I'm struggling.
items.rationale: Reflects envy and difficulty with others' achievements, though could also reflect general low mood or dispositional envy.

items.text: I believe I have special talents that the world has failed to recognize, and it makes me bitter.
items.rationale: The belief in special talents overlaps with grandiose narcissism, but the bitterness and sense of being overlooked pull it toward vulnerable narcissism.
